title: 114_hr3264
content: The "Helping Americans Save Act of 2015" is also known as the Saver's Credit Expanded. The "Helping Americans Save Act of 2015" or Saver's Credit Expanded includes an increase in income limits under Section 25B(b)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendments raise the income limits from $30,000 to $50,000, $32,500 to $60,000, $50,000 to $70,000, and $70,000 to $70,000. Additionally, there is a conforming amendment to the inflation adjustment in Section 25B(b)(3) of the Code. The "Helping Americans Save Act of 2015" expands the Saver's Credit by increasing income limits in Section 25B(b)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendments adjust the income limits and include a conforming amendment to the inflation adjustment in Section 25B(b)(3) of the Code. Additionally, Section 25B(a) is amended to adjust the credit amount for inflation after 2015. The amendments made by the "Helping Americans Save Act of 2015" increase income limits for the Saver's Credit in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The adjustments apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2014. SEC. 3. Retirement contributions and savings disregarded for certain means-tested programs. The TANF Program now includes a provision to disregard certain retirement accounts and contributions when determining eligibility for assistance. This applies to various retirement plans and accounts specified in the Internal Revenue Code and Federal Thrift Savings Plan. The TANF Program now disregards certain retirement accounts and contributions for eligibility. This includes retirement plans specified in the Internal Revenue Code and Federal Thrift Savings Plan. Additionally, the SSI Program has amended its income disregard to include amounts contributed by individuals to a program. The SSI Program has amended its income disregard to include funds contributed to specified retirement accounts and plans under the Internal Revenue Code and Federal Thrift Savings Plan. The SSI Program has amended its income disregard to include funds contributed to specified retirement accounts and plans under the Internal Revenue Code and Federal Thrift Savings Plan, exempt from tax under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. This exempts certain retirement plans, contracts, or accounts from household eligibility determinations for Low-Income Home Energy Assistance Program funds. The curr_chunk states that any retirement program or account exempt from tax under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, and other retirement plans determined by the Secretary of Health and Human Services, are included in the exemption.
